title.narrative: Training and Institutional Strengthening for Community Organisations and NGOs

description.narrative: The Instituto Cooperativo Interamericano was founded by the Scarboro Fathers in 1964, when it ran its first Latin America Course for community leaders (16 men and 6 women from 12 countries). It gained legal registration in 1967 and acquired its current premises in 1968. Its mission is "to offer men and women of social movements of Latin America an education that enables them and their organisations to strengthen processes of change for an equitable society and full and abundant lives". It fulfills this mission by designing and delivering an education programme for grassroots communities and NGOs. This project is supporting the 2014-2016 education plan. Over the three year period, ICI will offer regionwide courses in three subject areas: post-development, buen vivir, solidarity economy and the environment; institutional innovation, movements and strengthening of social organisations; personal reflection and renewal. A foundation course underpins all three, focussing on citizenship, human rights, participation and advocacy. Each of the areas will also include a module on "training for trainers", so that participants can replicate the course in their communities or organisations, or for other organisations. ICI is negotiating accreditation of their courses with universities in Panama. ICI will also offer a short course each year on Catholic Social Teaching. Aside from the courses, ICI offers accompaniment to social movements and organisations undergoing processes of institutional strengthening.
